decks.notes: The main idea of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a fast and aggressive offense. By using efficient creatures like Ragavan and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with removal spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply pressure and control the board. Counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Pierce help protect key threats, while cards like Murktide Regent provide a powerful late-game win condition. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation tools like Expressive Iteration and Consider to ensure consistency and adaptability in different matchups.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge to control the board. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to deal heavy damage to the opponent. With cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison providing additional support and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency and flexibility to the deck.

The deck focuses on cycling through its cards and manipulating the graveyard to eventually cast Living End, which brings all creatures from the graveyard onto the battlefield. It includes various cycling creatures and spells to quickly fill the graveyard and set up for the combo. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Negation and Subtlety to control the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures hitting the battlefield at once, setting up for a quick and decisive victory.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and Eldrazi creatures to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Through the Breach and Devourer of Destiny to cheat out big Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Defiler, the deck aims to quickly take control of the game. The inclusion of control elements like Kozilek's Command and Sowing Mycospawn help to disrupt the opponent's game plan while the Eldrazi Temple and Grove of the Burnwillows provide the necessary mana acceleration to cast the powerful creatures.

The main concept of the deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently through cheap spells and rituals, while also utilizing cards like Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage to reduce costs. The deck aims to chain together spells to create a storm count and then finish off the opponent with a powerful combo, such as Grapeshot. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Past in Flames to recur important spells from the graveyard and Wish to search for key pieces. This deck is designed to win quickly through explosive plays and efficient mana generation.

The main focus of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and control the board through cards like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and direct damage spells, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to apply pressure early in the game. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a Companion adds additional mana fixing and utility to the deck, allowing for a more consistent and adaptive game plan.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to quickly generate mana through rituals and card draw spells in order to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to create a storm of spells to overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on efficiently casting spells with the help of Ruby Medallion and Glimpse the Impossible while using Wish to search for specific cards when needed. The goal is to chain spells together to create a lethal combination and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with sacrifice effects to deal direct damage to the opponent and control the board. The key strategy is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with early threats like Gravecrawler and Boggart Trawler, while using cards like Goblin Bombardment and Chthonian Nightmare to control the battlefield and deal damage. By sacrificing creatures for value and utilizing cards like Undead Augur and Warren Soultrader for card advantage, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and finish them off quickly before they can stabilize.
